author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Major blast in Tianjin China shocks the city at midnight - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Major blast in Tianjin China shocks the city at midnight Published on : Thursday, August 13, 2015
Chinaâ€™s northern city of Tianjin witnessed a huge explosion leaving 17 people dead and hundreds injured. A chemical factory harbouring dangerous chemical goods exploded and the place was enveloped in flames blazing the sky and bringing some buildings down. There was chaos all around. An eye witness said that people covered in blood were walking like zombies across the streets.
The number of causalities is continuously increasing and the hospitals are finding it difficult to cope with the pressure. Every effort is being made to rescue the injured.
The senior managers of Ruihai Logistics, which owns the ware house where the explosion took place is being questioned by authorities. The shipment of explosives were said to be detonated according to unofficial sources.
The eight towers of high risers closest to the explosion had almost all the windows blown out. Most families had fled from their houses and had gathered on the grounds outside. The ground was shaking fiercely, cars in the parking lot and buildings were shaking. Many people thought it was an earthquake.
The cause of the explosion is not known yet. The magnitude of the explosion was the equivalent of detonating three tones TNT said the China Earthquake Networks Centre, while the second was the equivalent of 21 tonnes of explosives. According to local media 400 people have been injured among them 32 are critically injured. Four firefighters were among the dead.
Tianjin home to 15 million people is a major industrial and port area to the south-east of the Chinese capital Beijing.
